info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 3:43AM CDT until June 30 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Furnas.
* WHEN...Until 715 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain from earlier in the night had all but ended. However, minor flooding is likely still ongoing due to as much as 1.5 to 3.5 inches of radar-estimated rainfall, especially a few miles north-through-east of Beaver City. Flooding could be impacting some rural county roads. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Maple Creek, Honey Creek, Beaver Creek, Sappa Creek and Sheep Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Beaver City and Hollinger. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING
